summary: This document is the formal plea agreement and sentencing terms for Jeffrey Epstein in Florida state court. He pleads guilty to one count of solicitation of prostitution and one count of procuring a person under 18 for prostitution. The sentence includes incarceration, community control, and registration as a sexual offender. The document also includes extensive excerpts from Florida statutes detailing the conditions of community control and sexual offender registration requirements.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleads guilty to felony solicitation of prostitution (Case No. 06CF009454AMB) and felony procuring a person under 18 for prostitution (Case No. 08CF009381AMB). He is sentenced to 12 months in jail for the first count and 18 months of community control (with the first 6 months in jail) for the second count, to be served consecutively. He is also designated a sexual offender.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to two felony charges: solicitation of prostitution and procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.
His sentence included 12 months incarceration plus an additional 6 months incarceration as part of an 18-month community control term, totaling 18 months of jail time.
As a special condition of his community control, Epstein was to have no unsupervised contact with minors, with any supervising adult requiring approval from the Department of Corrections.
Epstein was formally designated as a Sexual Offender pursuant to Florida Statute 943.0435, triggering lifelong registration and reporting requirements.

The document attaches and incorporates the extensive statutory conditions for sexual offender registration and community control, including electronic monitoring, curfews, and prohibitions on living near places children congregate.
